text: a trial date has been set for six people who are facing a range of charges relating to an attack on a teenager at woodside in telford earlier this year .
the charges include conspiracy to murder , conspiracy to commit gbh with intent and false imprisonment .
the trial is due to start at the end of february .

documents.title: watch : shrewsbury prepares to welcome cyclo-cross event
text: the 2016 national cyclo-cross title will be decided in shrewsbury this weekend .
cyclists from all over the country are racing in the woods at the back of the shrewsbury sports village football fields from 10:00 .
dave mellor is one of those getting the course ready .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire knife angel sculptor now taking on gun crime
text: a knife amnesty that led to a giant angel sculpture being created in shropshire has been so successful that the man who came up with the idea is now turning his mind to firearms .
author: Oswestry and Borders Chronicle

text: our headlines this evening :
- telford man appears in court charged with ten sex offences against girls
- raf says laser pen shone at one of its helicopters could have been very serious
- sterling fall encourages shropshire satellite business to invest locally
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: brexit leads to satellite business investing in nesscliffe
text: the fall in sterling since the brexit vote has encouraged a shropshire company with bases all over the world to expand its site near nesscliffe , instead of one in germany .
speedcast provides satellite internet services for a range of industries including oil and gas rigs all over the planet via its array of communication dishes here in the county .
adam torie said that because sterling has dropped in value it was cheaper to do business in this country than on the continent .

documents.title: raf warns of laser pen dangers
text: the raf says an incident in which a laser pen was shone at one of its squirrel helicopters this week could have been very serious .
it said that there was a `` very significant risk of causing permanent blindness '' for the pilot and his crew , who were all wearing light-amplifying night-vision goggles for the training flight .
the raf also warned that if a pilot is blinded or distracted , it could put the aircraft into an `` extremely dangerous position '' .

documents.title: ice hockey : czech forward to get debut against wildcats
text: telford tigers new czech forward lubomir korhon is due to make his debut tomorrow against swindon wildcats .
telford are on a run of just one defeat in the last seven games , which has seen them open up an eight-point gap at the top of the english premier league table .
meanwhile , the tigers are still searching for a netminder to serve as back-up to sam gospel .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: telford man appears in court charged with sex offences
text: a 69-year-old telford man has appeared before magistrates in the town , charged with a number of sex offences involving girls .

james heywood , of bader close in apley faces charges five counts of unlawful sexual intercourse with a female under 13 years , two counts of indecent assault of a female under 14 years and three counts of assaulting a female aged 13 and over by penetration .
he is now due to appear before shrewsbury crown court on 9 january .

documents.title: blists hill to make christmas day tv appearance
text: the blists hill victorian town will be appearing on bbc two on christmas day .
it 's the location for a special festive edition of victorian bakers , in which four modern-day bakers learn about the way the job was done back then .
the tv crew used the victorian town 's bakery and two cottages - you can watch victorian bakers at christmas on christmas day at 21:30 and repeated on boxing day .

documents.title: laser pen shone at raf helicopter
text: police have issued a warning after a laser was shone at an raf helicopter flying over astley , near its base in shawbury .
it 's thought the beam was from a laser pen and the incident happened on wednesday night .
despite the distraction , the helicopter pilot was able to land safely .

documents.title: call for head of healthcare review to step down
text: the man in charge of drawing up plans for the future of healthcare in the county should step down , a leading shropshire councillor says .

simon wright is the lead on the sustainability and transformation plan ( stp ) board which has recommended moving hospital care out into the community wherever possible , but the plan has been criticised by nhs england .
karen calder , in charge of health at shropshire council , said because mr wright is also chief executive of the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust , he is too focused on emergency care .
there 's some great talents in that stp board and they need to concentrate on their own areas and i think an independent chair will address some of the criticisms in the nhs response . ''

documents.title: sheriffhales decide not to take up shifnal lights offer
text: the village of sheriffhales has decided not to take up an offer from neighbouring shifnal to borrow some christmas lights .
shifnal town council made the offer after thieves stole the majority of the sheriffhales lights earlier in the week .
the man who puts them up every year , peter young , said they had decided that as it was close to christmas , it would be simpler to rearrange the lights that remained .
the village is planning a number of fundraising events next year , to buy new lights .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: drink-drive simulator in telford shopping centre
text: a driving simulator , showing you what it 's like to drink-drive , is in telford town centre today .
west mercia deputy chief constable chris singer and police crime commissioner john campion have been among those sitting behind the wheel this morning .
in the last three years 10 people died and 108 were seriously injured in collisions in the west mercia region with drink or drugs being a contributory factor .
the telford 's ttc group , which runs driver re-education programmes , has arranged for the simulator to be there .

documents.title: your questions : origins of wem 's 'treacle mines '
text: jon edwards got in touch with us through the your questions section of the bbc website , to ask `` why is wem known by locals as the treacle mines ? ''
councillor pauline dee is always a good source of information about the town and she says there are two stories .
one is that there was a tanners in the town and that it gave off a glutenous by-product which looked a lot like treacle .
the other story involves a chemist shop in the town , run by a man called mr haynes .
during the war it was said that despite food-shortages , his shop never ran out of treacle , leading locals to joke that he had a treacle mine beneath the shop .
other towns around the country also claim to have treacle mines , for various reasons , but of course you ca n't really mine treacle .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

he was charged yesterday with four counts of unlawful sexual intercourse with a female under 13 years , two counts of indecent assault of a female under 14 years and four counts of assaulting a female aged 13 and over by penetration .

they have also released on bail two men in their twenties who were arrested after shots were fired in howle .
a vehicle was damaged in the incident , but nobody was hurt .

the wrekin mp mark pritchard , is against the proposals , which would involve downgrading telford 's a & e and moving women and children 's services to shrewsbury and said he has arranged a meeting with the health secretary .
meanwhile , the shrewsbury mp , daniel kawczynski , is happy with the proposals and appears keen to push forward with them this morning .
when all clinical & financial evidence is considered , it will become clear relocating children 's unit from the prh to rsh is wrong decision !

documents.title: labour takes overall control at telford and wrekin council
text: labour have won a seat from the conservatives in a telford and wrekin council by-election .
the conservatives had been hoping local mp lucy allan 's communications officer , rob cadman , could replace clive mollet , whose death caused the by-election , in horsehay and lightmoor .
mr cadman lost to labour 's raj metha .
the turnout was 17 % .
labour now has an overall majority .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrewsbury town manager determined to prove the doubters wrong
text: shrewsbury town 's manager paul hurst says he 's ready to prove the doubters wrong .
the town manager has admitted , he knows there were some who thought on his move from grimsby , that he was n't qualified enough to take on the shrewsbury job .
coming here , some people have said , you know it 's a bit of a surprise almost .
is it really a good move ?
time will tell ultimately , but i came with an idea of keeping us in the league and i know that that wo n't be easy .
and that it will take a lot of fight and spirit , but i was up for that and i still am . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: £ 2.7m raised in car parking charges for shropshire council
text: latest figures show car parking charges raised profits of more than £ 750m for councils in england .
shropshire council was towards the top of the table , raising £ 2.7m - a reduction on the previous year .
and telford and wrekin was towards the bottom raising £ 72,000 , up from a loss of £ 104k .
the figures for 2015-16 are `` eye wateringly large '' according to the rac foundation which compiled the data .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire roadworks alert as severn trent to spend £ 850k on pipe replacement

documents.title: lecturer says people with dyslexia should n't be written off
text: a shropshire lecturer says people with dyslexia should be given every chance to show what they can do instead of being written off .
the condition makes reading , writing and spelling difficult .
sarah probert only found out she was dyslexic when she was 18 .
she now teaches at north shropshire college and was recently named teacher of the year at the county 's dyslexia awards .
despite that , she said she had had to battle early in life against labels such as `` lazy '' .
i fought very hard .
i got myself to college .
it was there that i met a lecturer who said look sarah you 're bright , there 's something going on here .
one of the first things i will say when i have a new group of students is 'i 'm dyslexic ' , so there are no barriers .
the sky is the limit . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: brother pays tribute to man killed in car crash
text: tributes have been paid to a shrewsbury man who died in a crash last month .
cristiano malvone , who was 47 , died after a collision on the a458 near ford .
his brother gino said he was `` at home now '' with his mother and his father .
my brother cristiano was taken from me and his family too soon .
he was kind at heart , funny and a loving father to his daughter .
we will miss his cheeky personality which made him capable of making everyone around him feel alive - and that is how we feel in our heart and soul , that he will always be alive . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : trio out for shrewsbury 's trip to millwall
text: aj leitch-smith , sean whalley and joe riley have all been ruled out of shrewsbury town 's trip to millwall on saturday .
leitch-smith ( below ) has a knee injury and his recovery has slowed down this week .
while riley trained today , the town manager paul hurst says he wo n't be fit in time .

Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: long-running telford roadworks coming to an end
text: the final phase of work on telford 's limekiln roundabout is due to start tonight .
the delay-hit project started in march and is one of six roundabouts in the area to undergo work .
the final phase will involve closing the roundabout from 20:00 until 06:00 until 23 december to enable overnight surfacing works .

documents.title: independent review of hospital plans promised
text: an independent expert is expected to be brought in to review the decision-making process behind the future fit review of hospital services .
the leader of the future fit team , david evans , has made the commitment following concerns raised by telford and wrekin council - which is unhappy with its conclusions .
mr evans says he does n't yet know who will carry out the work , but he says it will be conducted within the current timescale , so as not to delay the process any further .
the plan is to start public consultation on the plans in the new year .

documents.title: reviews of hospitals data results in alternative conclusion
text: the data used by the nhs to make its hospitals recommendations has been reevaluated by one of telford and wrekin council 's number-crunchers - and they 've come to a different conclusion .

the authority says that `` if used without interpretation and bias '' that data should point to telford 's princess royal hospital as the best place for the county 's emergency department and for women and children 's services .
telford and wrekin council said the future fit review team 's conclusions showed `` many errors in methodology and assumptions '' and skewed their assessments in favour of shrewsbury .
it is threatening to launch a judicial review on monday , if telford 's health commissioners decide to push ahead with consultation on the plans .

documents.title: snout to see here : the full furry set
text: unique footage has come to light showing some of england 's best loved wild animals living in the same county .
it has taken shropshire wildlife trust five years to capture all seven native members of the mustelid family on camera .
they include a badger , stoat , weasel , polecat , pine marten , otter and american mink .

documents.title: women facing long journeys to see maternity consultants
text: an analysis of the time taken to transfer women in labour to a consultant-led maternity unit shows that from oswestry 's hospital , it 's a 34-mile ( 55km ) trip to the princess royal hospital in telford or 13 miles ( 21km ) to wrexham maelor hospital .
women using the maternity unit at ludlow hospital currently face a journey of either 31 miles ( 50km ) to telford or 26 miles ( 42km ) to hereford .

it can mean a journey of 50 minutes to get from shrewsbury to telford , or 87 minutes to get from oswestry to telford , the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust says , when you factor in the time for an ambulance to arrive and the time to transfer women to and from a ward .
the nhs trust said between 20 % and 25 % of women giving birth at midwife-led units ty end up being transferred .
the trust also said all mums-to-be are assessed throughout their pregnancy to check their suitability for an mlu birth and they are told about the transfer-times , should they need to be moved .
author: Elaine Muir
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: author jacqueline wilson backs children 's diary campaign
text: children 's author and president of shrewsbury children 's bookfest jacqueline wilson has backed a campaign to encourage children to keep a diary .
she said it `` increases your fluency and helps you become more comfortable at expressing yourself '' .
the tracy beaker author says she herself wrote a diary from the age of seven or eight and continued through her childhood and into her teens .
ms wilson told bbc breakfast she thinks writing a diary has a massive advantage over social media when it comes to expressing innermost thoughts and feelings .
the national literacy trust is calling for children to be given diaries as christmas presents , saying they help boost writing skills .

documents.title: plan to cut hip , shoulder and knee ops to save money
text: the number of hip , shoulder and knee replacements carried out on the nhs in shropshire could be drastically cut to save millions of pounds .

shropshire 's clinical commissioning group pays for the procedures , but it 's heading for a deficit of £ 26m by the end of the financial year and is aiming to save between £ 10m and £ 15m from its budget .
the man brought in to cut the ccg 's budget , simon freeman , believes it has been carrying out too many operations .
we seem to intervene surgically , in orthopaedics and planned orthopaedics , at levels way , way , beyond comparable health economies . ''

documents.title: golf : chesters not setting himself any targets
text: shropshire golfer ashley chesters says he has n't set himself any targets , in his first season on the european tour .
if he plays well , he could qualify for some end-of-year events , but says , `` i just want to play a full season and see where i end up . ''
the young player from whitchurch is just home from his first competition , where he earned £ 10,000 for a top-30 finish at the alfred dunhill championship in south africa .
i just want to get out there and try to play well and see where that puts me at the end of the year . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: health body 'open-minded ' over hospital proposals
text: telford 's health commissioners will go into next week 's meeting with a clear mind about hospital reorganisation proposals , according to the chair of the shropshire clinical commissioning group .

the leader of telford and wrekin council 's conservatives , has said he would like them to `` pull the plug '' on the recommendations , which say shrewsbury should have the county 's centre for emergency medicine .
the chair of the shropshire ccg , julian povey , said he had spoken to his counterpart at the telford ccg and had been reassured there was `` no pre-determination '' .

documents.title: call for telford health body to 'pull plug on hospital plans '
text: there 's been a call for telford 's health commissioners to `` pull the plug '' on plans to reorganise hospital services in the county .

local politicians in the town have been angered because health bosses want just one centre for major emergencies in the county , based in shrewsbury , and are planning to move telford 's women and children 's unit there too .
at a meeting of the authority last night councillor andrew eade ( above ) said the telford and wrekin clinical commissioning group had the power to veto the proposals , when it meets next week .
i 'm hopeful that the telford and wrekin commissioning group will pull the plug on it and stop the whole process , because we simply ca n't go on with this in the present form . ''

documents.title: online child sex offenders targeted
text: police have raided addresses across the west midlands this morning in an operation targeting people viewing and sharing sexually explicit images of children .
warrants were carried out at properties in stafford , telford and coventry .
a 62-year-old man from telford has been arrested on sus of possessing indecent images .
a 55-year-old man from stafford ; a 52-year-old man from stone and a 30-year-old man from fenton , stoke-on-trent , were all arrested on sus of distributing indecent images of children .
since operation safenet launched last year , teams across the region say they have carried out 593 investigations , arrested 353 people for sexual offences and safeguarded 491 children .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury ready for transfer window
text: shrewsbury town expect to be busy when the new year transfer window opens .
the new manager paul hurst has already said he needs to strengthen his squad to lift town off the bottom of league one - to safety .
the club 's chief executive brian caldwell says hurst has the backing of the board .
i think we all realise that we need to freshen things up , we need to get the players in that can hopefully ignite the season . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: college 'showing progress '
text: north shropshire college , branded inadequate by ofsted earlier this year , is making solid progress and that 's been noticed by inspectors , the college says .
since a highly critical report in january , it 's been closely monitored by inspectors .
the principal left suddenly last month .
peter mccann took over and faced a secondary ofsted inspection in his first few days .
ofsted 's report shows significant progress , what they regard as reasonable to good progress .
this is not an inadequate college . ''

documents.title: watch : the experiences of giving birth in shropshire
text: maternity care in parts of shropshire has been highlighted in a bbc investigation that finds one in four women are transferred from midwife-led units to wards staffed by consultants after facing complications .
both catherine buckley and angela gregory from shropshire planned to give birth at the midwife-led royal shrewsbury hospital , but their stories are very different .

documents.title: football : shropshire premier cup win for whitchurch
text: whitchurch alport are into the semi-finals of the shropshire fa premier cup .
last night they beat the lowest-ranked side left in the competition - allscott - 7-1 .
market drayton and newport are already through .
haughmond play shawbury next week .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watchdog recognises improvements made by police
text: a report by her majesty 's inspectorate of constabularies says improvements have been made in the way west mercia police keeps people safe and reduces crime .
in 2015 the force was told it `` requires improvement '' in those areas by the watchdog , but they 've now been judged as `` good '' .
the report also found the force had treated the people it serves with fairness and respect , and was good at ensuring its workforce behaves ethically and lawfully .

documents.title: council vote in favour of legal challenge over health plans
text: telford and wrekin councillors voted unanimously last night to start legal proceedings if proposed hospital changes go ahead .
health bosses want major emergencies treated in shrewsbury and the women and children 's unit moved there too .
telford would have a 24-hour urgent care centre and would be the home of planned surgery .
but the leader of the council , labour 's shaun davies , says he 'll fight to keep what they already have .

text: head coach tom watkins said key moments '' proved to be the difference in telford tigers ' 6-3 win over sheffield steeldogs last night .
telford now lead the english premier league standings by eight points , albeit with second-placed milton keynes having two games in hand .
that five on three at the end of the first period was absolutely huge for us and things like that are always little turning points . ''

documents.title: labour transfer times : 'i was trying not to have my baby '
text: it should have taken 15 minutes to transfer catherine buckley from a midwife-led unit to the care of a doctor .
instead , it took almost an hour to travel the 18 miles from shrewsbury to telford as the 35-year-old tried not to have her baby in the back of an ambulance .
her husband , jack , 32 , arrived half an hour before her .
eight months on , ralph is a happy , healthy baby , but his mother said she would not choose again to have a child at a freestanding midwife-led unit , with no doctors present .

she chose to use the midwife-led unit at the royal shrewsbury hospital , because it is the closest to her home , but was transferred during labour to the princess royal hospital in telford after experiencing complications .
on the way to the hospital i was going against every instinct at that point and trying desperately not to push . ''

documents.title: shropshire women face long journey if transferred to give birth
text: women in shropshire who opt to give birth locally , but are transferred because of possible complications , have to travel some of the longest distances in the country , research by the bbc has found .
about one in four women end up being transferred from midwife-led units to sites staffed by consultants , like the one in telford .
nhs bosses say stand-alone midwife-led units are just as safe as doctor-led hospital care for low-risk deliveries .
england 's data unit contacted 139 hospital trusts , receiving information back about 128 midwife-led units in england under the freedom of information act .

documents.title: councils say leaked nhs letter backs up their concerns
text: the leaked nhs england letter which criticises progress on shropshire 's future healthcare plan has been welcomed by both telford and wrekin and shropshire council .
both authorities raised concerns about the sustainability and transformation plan when it was published last week , saying it lacked detail and had flaws with its financial projections .
the letter from nhs england raises similar concerns .
nhs england 's concerns echo those that both councils made , particularly around a financial model that bears little resemblance to reality .
i am sure everyone will agrees this is a work in progress and that a considerable amount of further work is needed and this will take some time . ''

documents.title: collection for syrian refugees
text: campaigners raising money for shropshire 's syrian refugees are holding two collections in shrewsbury .
the group called shropshire supports refugees is looking for donations of clothes and household goods for families who 've recently arrived in the county .
collections are taking place between 19:00 and 21:00 tonight and 09:00 until 11:00 tomorrow at the quaker meeting room on coton mount .

Journalist, BBC Shropshire

text: the north shropshire mp , owen paterson has been suggesting changes to the uk 's immigration rules .
he was speaking in a parliamentary debate on the government 's timetable for leaving the european union .

documents.title: theft of christmas lights upsets village
text: the theft of the christmas lights in sheriffhales appears to have upset a lot of people .
peter young , the leader of the group which puts them up , said he found it hard to take after building the collection of lights through public donations over a number of years .
pippa hodgetts , who lives opposite the display , said the lights bring a lot of joy to people living in the village and they were finding it hard to explain to the children what had happened .
people have also been reacting on our facebook page .
it has been so upsetting for everybody .
the community has saved up over the years for these lights and we all enjoy to see them over the christmas period . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire health boss responds to leaked letter
text: the man leading a review of healthcare in the county has responded to a leaked letter from nhs england which criticised its progress so far .
simon wright said the sustainability and transformation plan was a `` working document and should not be seen as the finished article '' and he welcomed the concerns raised by nhs england .
mr wright said the leaked letter was an `` initial response '' from nhs england to an early draft of the plan and that detail would be added later .
he also said the plan should be `` seen in the context of a five-year plan that is still developing '' .
the letter , dated 1 december and signed by regional nhs bosses , called for a revised plan by christmas .

documents.title: sheriffhales gets offer of replacement christmas lights
text: shifnal has offered to help out neighbouring sheriffhales , after the village had some of its christmas lights stolen .
shifnal town council said it had some spares in storage and it is prepared to lend them , if sheriffhales can get them safety-checked .
meanwhile , people in sheriffhales are planning fundraising events for next year , to get them replaced permanently .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers sign former czech international
text: telford tigers have signed the former czech republic international lubomir korhon .
the 38-year-old forward has experience playing in this country after spending four years at sheffield steeldogs , scoring 270 points in 177 games , before leaving at the end of last season .
the paperwork for korhon wo n't be completed in time for him to play against sheffield tonight , but he should be available to take to the ice at the weekend .
six players have left the club since being offered new contracts and korhon is the first to join them .
rather than taking a chance on a guy , we know exactly what we 're getting with lubo .
i 've met him several times and he 's in great shape .
i have no doubt he will fit very well with this team and in the locker room .
it is about adding a body to the team and we 've got someone with real top-end ability .
he 's a real quality player . ''

documents.title: what price 'devo ' if we do n't punch our weight in lords ?
text: devolution revolution seems to be the topic that 's all the rage in the commons these days .
but the big challenge for that `` devo '' agenda in the midlands seems to be getting it through to the house of lords .
of 825 members of the upper house , only 36 either live in , or have substantial connections with , our part of the country - under 5 % .
so what price devolution if we do n't punch our weight ?
i 've been examining the issue in my latest blog on the bbc news website here .
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

his regular partner oswald the ostrich will also be making an appearance .

documents.title: thieves steal village christmas lights
text: thieves have stolen some of the christmas lights from the village of sherifhhales , near shifnal .
pippa hodgetts , who lives opposite , said three men were seen taking them down , before driving away in a van on monday night .
ms hodgetts explained the lights had been gradually built-up by the community over the past six years and that all the rope lights had gone , along with a waving santa .

BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : shropshire farmer unconcerned by avian flu warnings
text: warnings over avian flu might not have a major effect on the availability of geese and turkeys this christmas , according to a shropshire goose farmer .

poultry owners in england and wales will have to keep their birds indoors for the next 30 days as a precaution , to protect poultry from a virulent strain that 's been found in dead wild-birds in europe .
but william brisbourne from broomhill farm , in nesscliffe told us it wo n't affect farms like his .

Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

text: an investigation by midlands today has revealed that at least three-quarters of the mps in our region have been abused or threatened while doing their job .

we 'll have more on this story from 13:30 on bbc one in midlands today .

documents.title: criticism of county health plan a surprise
text: when shropshire 's health organisations published their sustainability and transformation plan for the county last monday , the chief executive of the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust said it had the support of nhs england .

but we now know that three days later it wrote to him saying the plan did n't detail how the growing deficit in local health bodies , particularly shropshire 's clinical commissioning group , would be dealt with .
the letter , leaked to bbc radio shropshire , talks of `` little confidence '' in the plan and demands it be updated before christmas .

text: it might be december , but this afternoon the weather will be sunny , with temperatures reaching 14c ( 57f ) .

documents.title: lorry spotted heading the wrong way down m54
text: a lorry was spotted heading the wrong way down the m54 last night .

police said they received two calls at about 22:30 reporting the vehicle going the wrong way around the roundabout at shifnal services and then driving down the slip road on to the m54 eastbound to join it going in the wrong direction .
they carried out a search , but were unable to find the lorry .
officers performed a rolling block on m54 to protect motorists.luckily , no sign of the lgv which must have corrected itself .
reports of a foreign registered lgv travelling the wrong way on the m54 between j4 & 3.officers attending .
drive carefully

did u catch it ?

documents.title: legal challenge on future of hospital considered by council
text: telford and wrekin council meets later , to prepare a possible legal challenge over the future of the town 's hospital .
the authority 's concerned about a recommendation that the most serious emergency cases should be treated at shrewsbury .

health bosses say the new system , which would still see round-the-clock cover for less serious injuries in telford , is safer , given the pressures on a & e and the difficulty in recruiting experienced staff .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: hope that police body-worn cameras will help prevent crimes
text: west mercia 's police and crime commissioner says the £ 1m being spent on body-worn cameras will help prevent crimes and gather clear evidence .
john campion says other forces have found that they also reduce the number of complaints against officers .
they 'll be introduced next year .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: learners waiting up to three and a half months to take their test
text: learner drivers in the county are having to wait up to three and a half months to sit their test .
the driver and vehicle standards agency says it 's recruiting more examiners to ease the backlog .
the longest waits are in oswestry and in whitchurch .
carly brookfield from the driving instructors association says the delays are partly because more people are wanting to learn .
the forecast for tests until the end of this year is about 1.8 million , which is a good 200,000 up on the last three years .
you 've had a spate of examiners retiring all at once .
this is more down to resource management .
you always see a peak in demand in people learning to drive after recession . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: health bosses have 'little confidence ' in plans for future of county 's health service
text: regional health bosses have dismissed a plan for the future of shropshire 's health service saying they have `` little confidence '' in it and demanding it be rewritten .
the stp - sustainability and transformation plan - was published last week , foreseeing a huge shift of services out of hospitals to local community hubs .
but a leaked letter from nhs england says the plan does n't address big deficits at shropshire 's commissioning body , nor say how the estimated £ 270m price tag for the changes will be paid for .
it tells leaders here to re-write the plan before christmas .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

text: telford tigers take on sheffield steeldogs tonight in a mid-week clash .

but he 's confirmed he 'll be staying for the rest of this season and the next .

documents.title: junior doctor leaves nhs over row on new government contracts
text: a junior doctor says she 's leaving the nhs , because of the protracted row with the government over new contracts .
caroline jones , who 's a single mum from shrewsbury , had most recently been working at a hospital in stoke-on-trent .
she says long days , including out of hours commitments , were getting too much .
i was n't seeing my children and that 's what it had come down to .
and with the new contracts from next august , for me , we know that the hours were going to increase , especially the out of hours commitments .
i was being made to choose between being a parent or being a doctor .
i really wanted to juggle both , but i failed . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police make three arrests for drug offences
text: three drivers were arrested by west mercia police last night for driving while under the influence of drugs .

3 positive drug drive arrests across shropshire during the night shift .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: funding of £ 1m agreed for body cams for police
text: police officers in west mercia will begin wearing body cameras next year after the police and crime commissioner agreed to spend £ 1m on the scheme .
the £ 1m is a joint investment with the warwickshire pcc for the west mercia and warwickshire forces , with west mercia putting up 69 % of the cost .
west mercia police says firearms officers and those carrying tasers will be first to receive the new cameras , before they are rolled out across the rest of the force .
i have seen first-hand the benefits these cameras have and have led the push for their introduction .

i am pleased to have reached this milestone and will continue to hold the chief constable to account to ensure the cameras are introduced on time , on budget and then used appropriately across the force

documents.title: waiting times for learners to take a driving test branded a 'disgrace '
text: a shropshire driving instructor says the waiting time for learners to take their practical test in the county is a disgrace .
it 's three and a half months to get a driving test in oswestry , two and a half months in whitchurch and two months for shrewsbury and telford .
national guidelines say you should n't have to wait more than seven weeks .
ron ingall , who works in whitchurch , thinks the system 's in crisis .
we 're a rural county and we have to travel .
i feel so sorry for the people who want to get tests , you 've got midwives who have to pass the test to get about the county .
they ca n't get tests .
if they fail the test they 're at the back of the queue again . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

text: the wem-born screen actor peter vaughan said he caught the acting bug while at primary school in wellington .
he went on to start a television career in the 1950s and appeared in more than 200 tv shows and movies , including the sitcom porridge (
speaking to the bbc earlier this year , he said it had all begun when he had been asked to recite a poem on stage in front of an audience of parents .

i recited this poem and at the end of which the reaction was such that the mothers all sighed 'ahhhh , is n't that nice ' and the fathers applauded and i thought 'oh yes ' , this is going to be very useful in my life .

documents.title: two shropshire stations among region 's quietest
text: shropshire has got two of the least-used railway stations in the west midlands .

broome , near craven arms , has the third fewest passengers in the region , with just over 1,500 using it over the past financial year , followed by hopton heath ( below ) , the next station down the heart of wales line .

the figures , from the press association , show the quietest station in the region is polesworth , in warwickshire , with 900 passengers a year and the busiest is birmingham new street , with almost 40 million entries and exits from the station in 2015/16 .

documents.title: peter vaughan enjoyed game of thrones role
text: peter vaughan 's most recent role was the elderly , blind maester aemon of the night 's watch in hbo 's fantasy series game of thrones , a role he said he thoroughly enjoyed .
he was in it for five years , recorded all his parts in northern ireland and described everyone involved in the show as `` absolutely first class at what they do '' .
after leaving the show he said he was `` pretty well retired from acting now '' and said he had recently turned down a film role .

documents.title: hospital reorganisation process 'not fair or open '
text: the leader of telford & wrekin council has set out his argument to keep women and children 's services in telford in a video message .

councillor shaun davies said the process had not been fair , open and transparent and the recommendations that had been made by the nhs future fit review were not in the interests of the whole council .

the proposal put forward last week involves downgrading the a & e department in telford , moving women and children 's services to shrewsbury and moving all planned surgery in the other direction , to telford .
telford & wrekin council is threatening to take the plans to a judicial review .

documents.title: wem-born actor had 62-year career
text: peter vaughan started his tv career in 1954 in a series called stage by stage and was a regular on our screens right up until the present day .
he played harry grout in porridge in the 1970s ( below ) and most recently maester aemon in game of thrones .
the wem-born actor also appeared in a number films , including remains of the day with anthony hopkins
in all , he was in 222 tv shows and movies and released his memoirs earlier this year .

documents.title: football : potential fa cup opponents have history of early exits
text: if shrewsbury town can win their replay and reach the third round of the fa cup they face what appears to be a daunting trip to the newly-redeveloped ashton gate to take on championship side bristol city .
their potential opponents are 11th in the division and have won six of their nine league matches at home , but their recent record in the fa cup is not quite as impressive .
the robins have been knocked out at the third round stage four times in the past five seasons , including one defeat to crawley town .
so is there hope of another cup upset for shrewsbury ?
author: BBC Sport

text: there 's disruption at mucklestone road in loggerheads this lunchtime :
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: fog warning for motorists
text: the highways agency is warning drivers to be extra careful on roads around shropshire , with fog continuing to cover the county .
it says areas of fog could reduce visibility to less than 100 metres .
this photo was taken by one of the bbc weather watchers near horsehay , telford , this lunchtime .

documents.title: breakingshropshire-born game of thrones actor dies
text: actor peter vaughan , best known for his roles in porridge and more recently game of thrones , has died .
born in wem , shropshire , he started his tv career in the 1950s and was 93 years old .

documents.title: spate of van thefts in oswestry
text: there 's been a spate of seven thefts from vans in the oswestry area over the past week , the police say .
in most cases the vehicles , containing tools , had been left locked and secured and the thieves had been able to break in without causing damage .
the police are warning van owners to park in well-lit areas and remove any valuables .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: triathlon club launched in ludlow
text: a triathlon club is being launched in ludlow tonight , at the town 's brewery .

the man behind it is lee hassan , who said thanks to the success of people such as the brownlee brothers ( above ) , the sport had `` absolutely boomed '' and he had been bombarded with calls from people wanting to start a club .

mr hassan has been involved in organising triathlon and duathlon events in the area for 20 years , but said he was looking for somewhere suitable to do the open water swimming element - at the moment they are using the pool at the south shropshire leisure centre .

BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : birds photographed on a frosty shropshire morning
text: the bbc weather watchers have been sharing plenty of photos of birds this morning , including these ones taken near tilstock and ludlow .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: guest house owner 'was prepared to offer couple her spare room '
text: the owner of a much wenlock guest house says she was prepared to offer a couple a room in her own house , to help them out of an online booking mix-up .
they 'd turned up thinking they had booked a room at the fox inn through a hotel website , only to find the guest house had not been told about the reservation .
sarah hopkins said there was no room at her hotel and most of the other guest houses in the town were full , but she was able to find them a bed elsewhere in the end .
if i had n't been able to get them in , which i was surprised , then i was almost going to offer them to stop at my house because i have spare room there .
it was either that or they were going to have to travel home

documents.title: weather : fog to remain for the rest of the day
text: this fog is going to remain with us for the rest of the day , but it should clear up by tomorrow .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: two shropshire bus companies lose licences
text: two shropshire bus companies linked to the failed gha coaches have also lost their operating licences .
following a public inquiry in birmingham yesterday , the traffic commissioner ruled rj 's of wem and rml 2418 limited were no longer `` in good financial standing '' .
the finding follows a similar investigation in wales into gha coaches , which resulted in a ban for its former directors , gareth and arwyn lloyd , from running bus firms .
gha firm went bust in july , with the loss of 320 jobs and causing disruption for a number of bus services in the county .

documents.title: police hunt 'wolf-looking animal '
text: the police are looking for your help , after sightings of what they describe as an `` injured wolf-looking animal '' on the a458 between bridgnorth and much wenlock .
the animal , which may be a dog , was spotted this morning in the muckley cross area , and they 're wondering if anyone else has seen it .
the team have been out looking for an injured wolf looking animal on the a458 in the muckley cross area , anyone else see it this morning ?
staff member spotted something on the way out of ford towards shrewsbury !
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: online booking mystery at guest house
text: the owner of a guest house in shropshire is trying to find out why an internet booking agency she 's never heard of appears to be renting out her rooms without permission .
two would-be guests turned up at the fox inn last saturday night thinking they 'd reserved a double room through an online company called happyrooms.com .
we 've tried to contact the company to get to the bottom of what 's happened , but so far we have n't heard back from them .
the venue says it has agreements in place with other hotel booking websites , but has no such deal with happyrooms.com and could n't give the couple a room because it was full .
the couple turned up with a printed out document , like you would expect .
we knew nothing about the booking
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: weather watchers : photos of a foggy start to the day
text: it 's been a foggy start to the day and there are plenty of murky photos being shared by the bbc weather watchers .
this one was taken near welshpool and the photo below of the swan emerging from the mist was taken near madeley .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: plans to reorganise health care are being 'rushed ' , say council leader
text: the chief executive of shropshire council , clive wright , says plans to reorganise healthcare in the county are being rushed through .
he 's also worried there is n't enough money to carry out the planned changes , which involve treating more patients in the community .
there is n't sufficient investment planned into the neighbourhood element of the stp [ sustainability and transformation plan ] .
we feel we 've been under pressure to put our proposals forward

documents.title: organisers pleased with oswestry christmas events
text: a series of events in oswestry , designed to create the festive spirit in the run-up to christmas , drew hundreds of people to the town , the organisers have said .
there were three events in all - a christmas procession and the music live event at the weekend and then the light switch-on before that .
town clerk david preston said they created a `` fantastic feel about the place '' and shared these photos with us .
author: James Bond
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager admits to pre-draw fa cup nerves
text: the shrewsbury town manager paul hurst says he will be a nervous viewer when the fa cup third round draw is made on bbc two this evening .
his side are still in the hat after their 0-0 draw with fleetwood at the weekend .
hurst 's side are ball number 61 and , despite the butterflies , he said he had to accept `` what will be will be '' when the draw is made .
sometimes if you are left in the draw and you see the teams whittling away and you 'think that ones alright ' or 'i do n't want to go there '
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: corbyn 's former home a 17th century farmhouse
text: jeremy corbyn 's childhood home , just outside newport , is described by estate agents savills as `` an enchanting period farmhouse , thought to have been built in the 1680s '' .
the five-bedroom house is up for sale with a guide price of £ 650,000 and has four reception rooms , exposed timber beams , open fireplaces and an acre of land .
savills says the property was once part of the duke of sutherland 's estate , but there is very little written about its history .
as a boy , mr corbyn went to the fee-paying preparatory school , castle house , in newport , before going on to study at adams grammar school .

documents.title: firefighter 's appeal after cars block street
text: people are being urged not to block streets with their cars , after fire engines were unable to get down a road in shrewsbury on saturday because of parked vehicles .

on this occasion , they were responding to a smell of burning which turned out to be a minor electrical fault , but shropshire fire and rescue service says it is a regular problem and poses real danger .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

text: temporary four-way traffic lights were operational on a major roundabout from today until later this month , council chiefs have confirmed .

documents.title: severn valley railway appeal raises £ 500,000 in one month
text: the severn valley railway has raised £ 500,000 in just one month , after putting shares up for sale .
it is hoping to sell 2.5 million of the £ 1 shares to raise money for a major revamp of its bridgnorth station and the shares will remain on sale for another 11 months .
work has already begun on the first phase of the bridgnorth development , with contractors sinking foundations for the station 's new refreshment room .

text: north shropshire mp owen paterson has called for a cooling down of rhetoric in the brexit debate as the government faces a crucial court ruling on the issue .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: man wearing balaclava exposed himself to teenager
text: a man wearing a balaclava indecently exposed himself to a teenage girl in shrewsbury .
the man was cycling along underdale road on friday afternoon when he stopped , exposed himself to the 16-year-old , then rode off towards abbey foregate .
west mercia police is appealing for information .

documents.title: woman in hospital after crashing into house
text: a woman was taken to hospital after the car she was driving crashed into a house in oswestry this morning .
emergency services were called to chaucer road at 07:57 and firefighters had to cut her free from the vehicle , before she could be taken to the royal shrewsbury hospital .
no damage was done to the house .

documents.title: labour leader 's former family home for sale with £ 650k guide price
text: jeremy corbyn 's former family home in shropshire is up for sale .
yew tree manor , on pave lane , in newport , is on the market with a guide price of £ 650,000 .
the labour leader lived at the house as a child in the 1950s .

documents.title: 'surgery to become safer ' under hospital reorganisation plans
text: the reorganisation of hospital services in shropshire could make make planned surgery safer and cut the number of cancellations , according to one of the people behind the proposals .

mark cheetham , who is charge of scheduled care for the county 's two hospitals , said he did n't think the public had yet seen the benefits of the plans to create one centre for planned surgery in shropshire , based at telford 's princess royal hospital .
mr cheetham also said there was a `` great sense of relief '' among hospital staff that `` finally a decision has been made '' .
the planned care site will provide a much better patient experience with a much reduced risk of cancellations and reduced risk of infections after surgery

documents.title: telford graveyard plans approved
text: changes at a telford churchyard have been approved , despite concerns raised on social media about the need to move some headstones .
the anglican church , in st george 's , won a pride in your high street grant to improve paths , create a new `` community-space '' and install a toilet .
the chancellor of the diocese of lichfield has visited the site and says that although moving them is a serious step , it is justified , because of the benefits .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury in the draw for fa cup third round
text: shrewsbury town and fleetwood town are both in the hat for the third round of the fa cup , after their 0-0 stalemate at the weekend .

the numbers to look out for in tonight 's draw , if you want one of the big teams , are : 13 ( chelsea ) , 2 ( arsenal ) , 23 ( liverpool ) , 24 , ( man city ) , 39 ( tottenham ) and 25 ( manchester united ) .

if you are hoping shrewsbury draw a minnow and get an easier route to the fourth round , the balls to watch for are : 55 ( barrow ) , 59 ( sutton united ) , 60 ( eastleigh or fc halifax town ) or maybe 51 ( stourbridge or northampton town ) .
the draw can be seen on bbc two at 19:00 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shropshire council to borrow £ 10 million in bid to coax jaguar land rover to county
text: jaguar land rover will be lured to shropshire with a £ 10 million investment to get a vacant business park off the ground .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: proposed hospitals shake-up not driven by lack of funds : mp
text: the conservative mp for the wrekin says proposals to downgrade telford 's a & e department and move women and children 's services to shrewsbury are not being driven by a lack of funds in shropshire .
mark pritchard says the blame should n't be placed on the government and is calling on all parties to work together .
mr pritchard welcomed the move by the labour-run telford and wrekin council to threaten a judicial review , saying he would welcome `` anything which brings scrutiny '' to the issue .

this is not being driven by a lack of funds , this is not being driven by jeremy hunt the health secretary , or from whitehall , this is being driven locally by the hospital trust , by the shropshire and telford ccgs because they say they are unable to recruit the necessary consultants

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers edge win over sheffield steeldogs
text: tigers coach tom watkins hailed a solid '' game as they returned to winning ways with a 5-4 win over sheffield steeldogs on sunday night .
victory over the yorkshire outfit restored the tigers ' six-point lead at the top of the english premier league , following saturday 's 6-2 loss to basingstoke bison .
as a team , i thought we played pretty solid tonight .
i thought we started both periods really well and that helped us . ''
author: BBC Sport

yellow warning of fog for west midlands

documents.title: football : free coaches to shrewsbury town 's fa cup replay
text: shrewsbury town are offering fans free coach travel to the fa cup replay away to fleetwood next tuesday .
the club 's chief executive brian caldwell says the players need the extra support for the game and is hoping the move will encourage more fans to travel .
the two sides drew 0-0 when they met in shrewsbury at the weekend .
we do appreciate this time of year that everyone is watching their money , prior to christmas .
and i think it 's only fair that the club up the tab from the supporters ' coaches that will be going to the game

documents.title: teenager dies after crashing into tree
text: an 18-year-old man died after crashing into a tree on a road near telford .
the crash happened on the b4176 at sutton maddock , near telford , just before 04:30 on saturday , close to new house farm .

documents.title: two shropshire coach companies scrutinised
text: two shropshire bus companies with links to the former bosses of gha coaches are the subject of a public inquiry , which starts today .
gha coaches , based in ruabon , ceased trading in july with the loss of 320 jobs .
later , brothers gareth and arwyn lloyd were disqualified from holding operator licences due to safety issues at gha .

the inquiry , overseen by the traffic commissioner for the midlands , will investigate the extent of gareth and arwyn lloyd 's involvement with shropshire coach companies rjs of wem and rml 2418 ltd .
it will also receive a report from the driver and vehicle standards agency ( dvsa ) , which has been investigating the road-worthiness of vehicles and driver hours .
the hearing could last several days .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: funding could be problem for hospital plans : nhs leader
text: a leading supporter of plans to reorganise shropshire 's hospitals says they might struggle to attract funding , because of competition from elsewhere in the country .
it 's thought £ 300m would be needed to create a new a & e unit at the royal shrewsbury hospital and a round-the-clock urgent-care centre in telford .
more money would also be needed to move telford 's women and children 's centre .

mark cheetham , the care group medical director for the two hospitals , said the plans had been well thought out but there were lots of other hospital trusts drawing up what are known as sustainability and transformation plans at the moment .
every sustainability and transformation plan in england is producing plans at the moment and a lot of those are looking at capital money .
i do n't know where we are in the queue .
i hope we are at the top

documents.title: football : harrogate 2-1 afc telford united
text: telford 's assistant boss larry chamber says they ca n't blame the pitch for their defeat at the weekend .
harrogate use an artificial playing surface and beat the bucks 2-1 .
we win two , then we go and lose two .
we 're not showing the consistency that the players should be .
too many times this season we 've been away from home and come away with nothing . ''

documents.title: new £ 5 note is cleaner , say shropshire scientists
text: scientists at harper adams university in shropshire say the new £ 5 notes are much cleaner because fewer bacteria stick to them .
researchers have spent two years doing experiments to find out how clean our money is - including putting the cash in a special washing machine inside a laboratory .
the study suggests the new plastic notes are at least three times cleaner than the old ones .

documents.title: protest over ludlow maternity unit proposals
text: hundreds of people marched through ludlow at the weekend in support of its maternity services .
protesters fear midwife-led services at the town 's community hospital could close or be scaled down under reorganisation plans , forcing pregnant women to travel to other sites .
the trust running the hospital said it would continue to provide `` midwifery-led care in all care settings '' .

text: racing at ludlow this afternoon 's been abandoned .

racing abandoned due to frost .
-4 at present , with a cloudy day forecast .
in this day and age why was the track not covered
unfortunately i am not surprised given the forecast last night .

documents.title: a chilly start this morning

another very cold & frosty start .
however , much milder conditions already into sw will dominate our weather from tomorrow .

documents.title: historic house hit by fire
text: an investigation 's under way after a big fire in bridgnorth overnight .
innage lea had been empty since last year and was recently saved from demolition .
david cooper from bridgnorth civic society says it 's a shame after all the group had done to try to protect it .
we 're obviously quite upset .
the fire seems to have damaged it quite badly . ''
